channel.title: Hydrology on hydroblog
channel.description: Recent content in Hydrology on hydroblog

item.title: Graphing Using whitewater
item.description: Intro Get Data Raster Graph Hysteresis 3D Spaghetti Conclusion References Intro {whitewater} was originally developed for parallel processing but has always had some data wrangling and transformations sugar that can help visualize USGS NWIS data effectively. In this post we’ll use the advantages of {whitewater} to look at a site graphically a few different ways (tiled, hysteresis, 3D spaghetti). Get Data Let’s load the packages. We’ll use {ggfx} to give it an extra effects but you don’t necessarily need it.

item.title: Baseflow Index (BFI)
item.description: A quick tutorial on the {lfstat} baseflow().

item.title: Hydrology Distributions: Part I
item.description: Part I in a series about hydrology distributions. Part I goes over descriptive statistics and pmf, pdf and cdf.

item.title: Ridges & Wes Anderson
item.description: This is a quick exploration into the {wesanderson} and {ggridges} using USGS daily data.
